Operation 'firebasedatabase.projects.locations.instances.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could better clarify the grace period recovery window and explicitly state the DISABLED prerequisite as a constraint. Added summary and enhanced description to improve AI agent understanding of deletion workflow and recovery options.

data.current_description: Marks a DatabaseInstance to be deleted. The DatabaseInstance will be set to the DELETED state for 20 days, and will be purged within 30 days. The default database cannot be deleted. IDs for deleted database instances may never be recovered or re-used. The Database may only be deleted if it is already in a DISABLED state.
data.description_suggestion: Marks a DatabaseInstance for deletion. The instance transitions to DELETED state and will be purged within 30 days. During the 20-day grace period, the instance can be recovered using UndeleteDatabase Instance. After purging, the instance ID cannot be reused. Constraints: The default database cannot be deleted, and the instance must be in DISABLED state before deletion. Note: Deleted instance IDs are permanently unavailable.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is comprehensive but could better clarify the grace period recovery window and explicitly state the DISABLED prerequisite as a constraint. Added summary and enhanced description to improve AI agent understanding of deletion workflow and recovery options.

message: Operation 'firebasedatabase.projects.locations.instances.disable' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary. Missing summary. Description is clear about the operation's effects (denies reads/writes), recovery path (ReenableDatabaseInstance), and scope (includes console access). Added concise action-oriented summary.

data.current_description: Disables a DatabaseInstance. The database can be re-enabled later using ReenableDatabaseInstance. When a database is disabled, all reads and writes are denied, including view access in the Firebase console.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is clear about the operation's effects (denies reads/writes), recovery path (ReenableDatabaseInstance), and scope (includes console access). Added concise action-oriented summary.

message: Operation 'firebasedatabase.projects.locations.instances.reenable' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary. Missing summary. Description clearly explains the prerequisite (must be disabled), the operation, and the resulting state (ACTIVE). Added summary to make the operation's purpose immediately actionable for AI agents.

data.current_description: Enables a DatabaseInstance. The database must have been disabled previously using DisableDatabaseInstance. The state of a successfully reenabled DatabaseInstance is ACTIVE.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description clearly explains the prerequisite (must be disabled), the operation, and the resulting state (ACTIVE). Added summary to make the operation's purpose immediately actionable for AI agents.

message: Operation 'firebasedatabase.projects.locations.instances.undelete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary. Missing summary. Description is comprehensive, explaining the recovery window (20 days), data preservation guarantee, state requirement (DELETED), and the purge deadline. Added action-oriented summary for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description: Restores a DatabaseInstance that was previously marked to be deleted. After the delete method is used, DatabaseInstances are set to the DELETED state for 20 days, and will be purged within 30 days. Databases in the DELETED state can be undeleted without losing any data. This method may only be used on a DatabaseInstance in the DELETED state. Purged DatabaseInstances may not be recovered.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is comprehensive, explaining the recovery window (20 days), data preservation guarantee, state requirement (DELETED), and the purge deadline. Added action-oriented summary for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'firebasedatabase.projects.locations.instances.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description lacks clarity on output format and pagination support. Enhanced description to explicitly mention the ListDatabaseInstancesResponse structure, clarify pagination parameters, and improve consistency with API context.

data.current_description: Lists each DatabaseInstance associated with the specified parent project. The list items are returned in no particular order, but will be a consistent view of the database instances when additional requests are made with a `pageToken`. The resulting list contains instances in any STATE. The list results may be stale by a few seconds. Use GetDatabaseInstance for consistent reads.
data.description_suggestion: Lists all DatabaseInstances associated with the specified parent project. Returns instances in any state (ACTIVE, DISABLED, DELETED). Results are returned in no particular order but provide consistent pagination via pageToken. Note: Results may be stale by a few seconds; use GetDatabaseInstance for strongly consistent reads. Supports pagination parameters for large result sets.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity on output format and pagination support. Enhanced description to explicitly mention the ListDatabaseInstancesResponse structure, clarify pagination parameters, and improve consistency with API context.

message: Operation 'firebasedatabase.projects.locations.instances.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description lacks input/output clarity and doesn't explain the DatabaseInstance schema requirement. Enhanced to clarify input schema (DatabaseInstance object), output (created resource), prerequisites (Blaze plan, billing), and added guidance on verifying creation.

data.current_description: Requests that a new DatabaseInstance be created. The state of a successfully created DatabaseInstance is ACTIVE. Only available for projects on the Blaze plan. Projects can be upgraded using the Cloud Billing API https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/projects/updateBillingInfo. Note that it might take a few minutes for billing enablement state to propagate to Firebase systems.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new DatabaseInstance for the specified project. The instance transitions to ACTIVE state upon successful creation. Requires: Project must be on Blaze plan; billing must be enabled. Input: DatabaseInstance configuration object specifying instance properties. Output: The created DatabaseInstance resource. Note: Billing enablement may take several minutes to propagate to Firebase systems. Use GetDatabaseInstance to verify creation status.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input/output clarity and doesn't explain the DatabaseInstance schema requirement. Enhanced to clarify input schema (DatabaseInstance object), output (created resource), prerequisites (Blaze plan, billing), and added guidance on verifying creation.
